summary: Introduced in the House of Representatives by Rep. Hageman, H.R. 230 is a bill that seeks to block a specific federal action. It would prohibit the Secretary of the Interior from implementing, administering, or enforcing the 'Approved Resource Management Plan Amendment' for the Bureau of Land Management's (BLM) Buffalo, Wyoming Field Office. This action directly targets the resource management plan amendment whose record of decision was published in the Federal Register on November 27, 2024. Essentially, the bill aims to prevent planned changes to the management of public lands and resources in that specific area.
